repo_notes.content: DataServer is a robust and dynamic server designed to collate and serve live data to a dashboard. The server is built with flexibility in mind, enabling easy changes and additions of new data sources through a loosely-coupled, extensible codebase. The backend follows Clean Architecture principles with clear separation of concerns across layers. Data flows from external WebSocket APIs through the application and out to consumers via REST API and SignalR for real-time updates.
repo_notes.author: Project Owner

repo_notes.content: The server/ folder contains the main application following Clean Architecture with these layers: DataServer.Api (HTTP API and SignalR endpoints), DataServer.Application (business logic and interfaces), DataServer.Connectors (external data source implementations designed for extensibility), DataServer.Domain (core entities with no dependencies), DataServer.Infrastructure (caching, logging, repositories), and DataServer.Tests (unit and integration tests).
repo_notes.author: Project Owner

repo_notes.content: The simulators/ folder contains mock data sources for entirely local deployments. These simulators allow the server to run without connecting to real external APIs, enabling development and testing in isolation. Running deployments with either mock sources or real sources by simply changing configuration files demonstrates the flexibility and loose coupling of the server architecture.
repo_notes.author: Project Owner

repo_notes.content: Key design principles: Data source implementations are abstracted behind interfaces, allowing new sources to be added without modifying core business logic. The Connectors layer is designed to easily accommodate additional data sources. Switching between mock and real data sources is achieved through configuration changes, not code changes.
repo_notes.author: Project Owner
